alert.note: Alert for Henderson (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Paducah (Southern Illinois and Indiana, Southeastern Missouri and Western Kentucky)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued June 29 at 9:19PM EDT until June 29 at 9:45PM EDT by NWS Paducah
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 845 PM CDT FOR SOUTHWESTERN WARRICK...EAST CENTRAL VANDERBURGH...WEST CENTRAL SPENCER...NORTHWESTERN DAVIESS AND NORTHEASTERN HENDERSON COUNTIES... At 819 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Newburgh, moving southeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Golf ball size hail and 70 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect hail damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. Expect considerable tree damage. Wind damage is also likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. Locations impacted include... Evansville, Boonville, Newburgh, Chandler, Stanley, Eureka and Hebbardsville. This includes the following highways... Interstate 69 in Indiana between Mile Markers 1 and 13. Audubon Parkway between Mile Markers 12 and 16. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.75 IN WIND THREAT...OBSERVED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
